oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Advertisement for a speech by Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Broadside advertising a speech by Dr. Martin Luther King at the War Memorial Building, a benefit concert by Harry Belafonte and Troupe at the Ryman Auditorium, a meeting of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference, and an address by Spottswood W. Robinson. The only dates listed are September 27-29.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; King, Martin Luther, Jr., 1929-1968; Belafonte, Harry, 1927- ; Southern Christian Leadership Conference
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Martin Luther King, Baptist minister and prominent civil rights activist, was a leader in ending segregation in America in the 1950s & 1960s using peaceful means. Harry Belafonte is a successful Calypso artist and civil rights activist. Spottswood William Robinson III was a faculty member and later dean of Howard University School of Law. He participated in the "Brown v. Board of Education" case and was the first African American appointed Chief Judge of the District of Columbia Circuit Court.
